intro: Guatteria ouregou, commonly known as the Ouregou waxplant, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurel trees and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. Its fruit is a bright red, fleshy berry that contains several seeds. Guatteria ouregou is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has a mild, pleasant scent when crushed.
